Legal_Issue: Breach of duty of fairness, error in law during H&C review
Evidence_Assessment: Marriage genuineness, risk evidence, letters, risk assessments
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate error or unfairness
Legal_Rule: Minister may exempt based on H&C considerations; duty of fairness requires minimal procedural obligations
Procedural_Issue: No hearing or written reasons required unless legal error, improper principle, or bad faith
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged failure to properly assess marriage and risk evidence
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of duty of fairness
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) grounds under Immigration Act
Applicant_Challenge: Officer erred in assessing marriage and ignored risk evidence
Defendant_Response: Officer considered all evidence and applied correct legal principles
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal declarations, risk reports
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under s. 82.1(1) of the Immigration Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 114(2), s. 82.1(1) of the Immigration Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: None established; application denied on H&C assessment
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
